Satisfactory survey

Since 2008 we have asked our students to give us some feedback.

For “Real name” you can use an anonymous alias

Student's interest in in open source

<doodle twentw204j_2|2a. After one month of use Open Source tools are you still interested to use in the future?>

Yes No

</doodle>

<doodle twentw204j_3|3a. After one month of use Open Source do you see any interest and value in using Open Source tools in your current and future job ? >

The same as before Now less than before Now more than before

</doodle>

How do you judge the training

<doodle twentw2014j_7|7a. Overall, how would you rate the second week of the workshop?>

Extremely Useful Very Useful Somewhat Useful Not Useful

</doodle>

<doodle twentw2014j_aa|8a. Do you think the training in second week was well adapted in respect of your needs, your skills and knowledge?>

Advanced and too difficult well adaptedbasic and boring

</doodle>

</doodle>

Suggestions for future courses

<doodle twentw2014j_11|12a. If you were going to re-attend the course you will opt for which one of the time slot? >

Only one week Two consecutive weeks Two weeks with one month of self learning

</doodle>

<doodle twentw2014j_11|12a. If we organize a course in advance programming (parallel process, working in tiles, C++ language) would you like to attend it? >

Yes but only 2 days Yes but only 3 days Yes but only 4 days Yes but only 5 Not at all

</doodle>

<doodle twentw2014j_11|12a. In the course the two sections “listening/doing pre-existing exercises” and “working by your self” was correctly balanced? >

Yes, well balance No, I would like more time for working with my data No, I would like more time for doing pre-existing exercises
